alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 26 at 12:53PM MST until June 26 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Persist... .A prolonged period of windy conditions, combined with low teen to single digit RHs, will result in a multi day stretch of critical fire weather conditions. Conditions start today for areas along and north of the Mogollon Rim where the RFW is out. Strongest winds will be Tuesday and will occur at both higher and lower elevations, resulting in a widespread RFW that encompasses almost all of northern Arizona. Windy conditions will persist into Wednesday, but be shifting eastward. A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for Wednesday because of this. ...A RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN ARIZONA FROM THE MOGOLLON RIM NORTH AND NORTHEAST... ...A NEW RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON MDT/ TO 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ TUESDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... ...A NEW FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PARTS OF NORTHERN ARIZONA STARTING FROM THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AROUND PRESCOTT AND NORTHEAST OVER THE MOGOLLON RIM TO THE FOUR CORNERS REGION... The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MST /noon MDT/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ Tuesday. A new Fire Weather Watch has also been issued and is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Buffalo Pass, Chinle, Dilkon, Doney Park, Eagar-Springerville, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Ganado, Heber-Overgaard, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Saint Johns, Shonto, Snowflake-Taylor, Tuba City, Williams, Window Rock and Winslow. This includes portions of the Apache- Sitgreaves National Forest, Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest, Prescott National Forest and Tonto National Forest. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 6 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. Please notify field crews of this Fire Weather Watch.
